ext_descriptions.ext_description: A centre_type lists the types of the center.
specifies that value is centered on the arc;
specifies that value is centered on the radial.
A dimension_qualifiers lists the valid qualifiers of the dimension.
specifies that value is free state;
specifies that value is avarage;
A geometric_tolerance_qualifiers lists the valid qualifiers of the geometric tolerance.
specifies a pitch diameter;
specifies a minor diameter;
specifies an each element;
specifies a major diameter;
specifies an each radial element;
specifies that a value is not concave;
specifies that a value is not convex;
specifies that a value is in free state;
A measure_orientation lists the values of the measure orientation.
specifies that a value is reversed;
specifies that a value is normal;
A offset_types lists the types of the offset.
specifies that a value is towards material;
specifies that a value is away from the material;

An Apex is a type of that is either a point that is derived by projecting a conical surface or the common point that is derived by projecting two or more conical surfaces. The from which the Apex is derived are associated with the Apex by the that are specified as the .
The common intersection of three or more planes or two curves shall be treated as a rather than as an Apex.
The form of the Shape_elements from which the Apex is derived shall be consistent with conical surfaces from which an Apex can be derived.

ext_description.p: A Datum_based_length_measure is a dimensional measure of length that is taken from a defined .

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates the usage of a Datum_based_length_measure.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Datum_based_length_measure. A is required in order to support equivalent description between the 2d and 3d shape representation cases.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Datum_based_length_measure or specifies the role of the string 'normal' or specifies the role of the string 'reversed'. 'Normal' shall be interpreted as a description equivalent to the three dimensional concept of a vector parallel to the normal of the plane that is the datum upon which the Datum_based_length_measure is based. 'Reversed' shall be interpreted as a description equivalent to the three dimensional concept of a vector anti-parallel to the normal of the plane that is the datum upon which the Datum_based_length_measure is based. For the case that the is a , the vector shall be in the XZ plane of the , where the Z axis is the normal vector of the . The measure_orientation is measured from the X axis in the XZ plane. For the two-dimensional case, the if used, is considered to be congruent with the XY coordinate system.
ext_description.note: The use of descriptive items allows the information to be conveyed when the geometric context is 2d, since orientation only supports a description within a 3d geometric context.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Datum_based_length_measure.

ext_description.p: A Datum_difference is the basis for mapping from a geometric context model into a lexical context model for definitional purposes. A Datum_difference identifies the length or angular difference between two . The difference may be referenced independently of the originating geometric model representation.
ext_description.note:
One
may be located at the origin if a simple location is intended.
The origin reference for a simple angular difference should be the X axis for two-dimensional case, and the XY axis for three-dimesional case.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Datum_difference. The subsequent_datum is the other datum in the Datum_difference.

specifies a role of the
for the Datum_difference. The precedent_datum is the reference datum.

A Datum_difference_based_characteristic is a type of . A Datum_difference_based_characteristic is provided to allow characterization based on a geometric model. This is typically used where there is a reference geometric model available.

specifies a role of the
for the Datum_difference_based_characteristic.

A Boundary_size_characteristic is either a
or an . A Boundary_size_characteristic is a definition that characterizes the size of the .

specifies the
that represents the maximum size of the Boundary_size_characteristic. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the
that represents the tolerance size for the Boundary_size_characteristic.

ext_description.p:
A Centre_axis is a type of
that is axial in form. The
from which the Centre_axis is derived are associated with the Centre_axis by the
that are specified as the .
ext_description.note:
The attribute
is declared in the entity of which this entity is a subtype.

The precise interpretation of a Centre_axis is context dependent. That is, the distinction is not made between an axis of a feature and a derived median line of a feature as defined in 1.3 of ASME Y14.5M.

example.p: A and a may be applied to the same Centre_axis of a cylindrical .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.
The form of the Shape_elements from which the Centre_axis is derived shall be consistent with the form of shape elements from which a centre axis can be derived.
A Centre_of_symmetry is a type of that is derived by determining the geometric centre of one or more . A Centre_of_symmetry is one of a , a , or a .

A Centre_plane is a type of
that is planar in form. The
derived from the Centre_plane is associated with the Centre_plane by the
that are specified as the .

The
shall not be populated.
The form of the Shape_elements from which the Centre_plane is derived shall be consistent with the form of shape elements from which a centre plane can be derived.

ext_description.p:
A Centre_point is a type of
the form of which is that of a point. The
from which the Centre_point is derived are associated with the Centre_point by the
that are specified as the .
ext_description.note:
The attribute
is declared in the
entity of which this entity is a subtype.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.
The form of the Shape_elements from which the Centre_point is derived shall be consistent with the form of shape elements from which a centre point can be derived.

ext_description.p:
A Composite_linear_profile_refinement_tolerance is a type of
that is used to apply a more restrictive specification on the form, orientation, and possibly size of a
than on the location of the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies one of the
to which this Composite_linear_profile_refinement_tolerance assists in specifying design requirements by specifying a further refinement of the form, orientation, and possibly size of the .

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance is a type of
that is used to apply a more restrictive specification on the form, orientation, and possibly size of a
than on the location of the . If the Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance is also a
the defined
is oriented but not located relative to the datum system.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies one of the
to which this Composite_surface_profile_refinement_tolerance assists in specifying design requirements by specifying a further refinement of the form, orientation, and possibly size of the .

The
shall not be populated.

A Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary is a type of
that is conical in form. The shape of the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary is defined by a frustum the size of which is specified at the surfaces that define the ends of the frustum.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary is dependent on the existence of two
that specify the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary as their . There shall be exactly two
for a Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary.

The
shall not be populated.
A Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_and_surface_relationship is a relationship that associates a with one of the two at which the diameter is specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_and_surface_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_and_surface_relationship as its .
specifies the at which the diameter is specified for the .

specifies a role of the
for the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_and_surface_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the the diameter of which is specified at the specified as the terminating_surface.
A Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_diametrical_size_characteristic is a definition that characterizes the size of a at one of the that defines the ends of the .
specifies the that represents the diameter of the specified at the specified for the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_diametrical_size_characteristic.
specifies the that associates the with a that defines an end of the at which the size is characterized by the Conical_tolerance_zone_boundary_diametrical_size_characteristic.

ext_description.p: A Conical_tolerance_zone_definition is a type of . A Conical_tolerance_zone_definition is defined when it is desired to place a more restrictive specification on one end of a than on the other end.
ext_description.note: Conical tolerance zones are described in 5.8 of ASME Y14.5M.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Datum_axis is a type of
that is a theoretically exact axis to which toleranced
are related.

The
shall not be populated.
A Datum_axis_and_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the by which it is oriented.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Datum_axis_and_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Datum_axis_and_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship as its .
specifies the by which the that is specified as the oriented_tolerance_zone is oriented.
specifies the that is oriented with respect to the specified as the orienting_datum_axis.

A Datum_axis_related_orientation is a definition that characterizes the orientation of a
in relation to a .

specifies a label that indicates the manner in which the specified
is oriented with respect to the specified . The orientation_type shall be one of the centre_types.
specifies the that associates the with the with which it is oriented. The specified is characterized by the Datum_axis_related_orientation.
A Datum_based_direction_vector is a characterization of a direction away from and normal to a .

specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Datum_based_direction_vector is in a positive or negative sense. A value of TRUE indicates that the Datum_based_direction_vector is in the positive sense. A value of FALSE indicates that the Datum_based_direction_vector is in the negative sense.
specifies the from which the Datum_based_direction_vector is based.
specifies an that is a representation for the Datum_based_direction_vector.

A Datum_based_vector_orientation is a definition of the orientation of a shape element that has the form of a vector and is based on the intersection of two shape elements that have the form of half-planes. Where a half-plane has the form of a plane except it is bounded on one side by a straight line. Each half-plane shape element is oriented with respect to three and is defined by a .

specifies the that defines the half-plane shape elements the intersection of which forms the vector that is defined by the Datum_based_vector_orientation. There shall be exactly two for the Datum_based_vector_orientation.

A Datum_plane is a type of
that is a theoretically exact plane to which toleranced
are related.

A Datum_point is a type of
that is a theoretically exact point to which toleranced
are related.
A Derived_non_feature_shape_element is a type of that is derived from a set of one or more other . A Derived_non_feature_shape_element is one of an , a , a , a , a , or a .

ext_description.p: specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Derived_non_feature_shape_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Derived_non_feature_shape_element as its shape element. There shall be one or more specified as the deriving_relationships for a Derived_non_feature_shape_element.

example.p: The of a cylindrical hole is a Derived_non_feature_shape_element. The cannot exist unless the hole exists.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Shape_element_deriving_relationship is a type of that associates a with a from which the is derived.

the first of the instances of Shape_element_deriving_relationship that is part of the relationship. It specifies the that is the that is derived from the specified as the for the Shape_element_deriving_relationship.
The combination of the shape element inherited from and inherited from shall be unique within a population of Shape_element_deriving_relationship.
A Diametrical_boundary_size_characteristic is a type of that defines the diameter of a .
specifies the , the diameter of which is defined by the Diametrical_boundary_size_characteristic.

ext_description.p:
A Dimension_qualifier is a description that qualifies one or more . A Dimension_qualifier is either a
or a .
ext_description.note: Qualifying notes are described in 5.3 of ISO/DIS 1101.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
to which the Dimension_qualifier applies. There shall be one or more
specified as the qualified_dimensions for a Dimension_qualifier.

A Dimension_related_positional_boundary is a type of
that is a theoretical boundary that is composed of a set of one or more . Each
is defined by a separate .

specifies the
that is to be constrained by the Dimension_related_positional_boundary.

specifies the
that comprise the Dimension_related_positional_boundary. There shall be one or more
specified as the boundary_members for the Dimension_related_positional_boundary.

specifies a role of the
for the Dimension_related_positional_boundary. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Dimension_related_positional_boundary_definition is a type of that characterizes a .

specifies the that characterize each that comprise the . There shall be one or more specified as the characterized_boundary_member_definitions for the Dimension_related_positional_boundary_definition.
specifies the that is characterized by the Dimension_related_positional_boundary_definition.
A Dimension_set is a set of that specify the theoretically exact shape of a .
specifies the that are associated with the Dimension_set. There shall be one or more specified as the associated_dimensions for the Dimension_set.

A Dimensional_characteristic_representation is an association between a
and the
that represents the .

ext_description.p:
specifies the boolean value that indicates whether the associated
is to be considered a requirement for the associated
or is specified for informational purposes only. A value of TRUE indicates that the associated
is for informational purposes only. A value of FALSE indicates that the associated
is to be considered a requirement.
ext_description.note: Auxiliary dimension is defined in 3.1.1.3 of ISO 129.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies one of the
that is represented by the specified
for the Dimensional_characteristic_representation.

specifies the
that represents the specified
for the Dimensional_characteristic_representation.
A Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries is a type of that characterizes the size of a as well as characterizing the relationship between two opposing from which the is composed.

ext_description.p: specifies the for which the size is characterized by the Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries.
ext_description.note: The attribute is_applied_to is declared in the entity of which this entity is a subtype.

example.p: The size of a that consists of two opposing surfaces of a notch would be characterized by a Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that specifies the two Shape_elements that are on the boundary of the for which the separation is characterized by the Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries and is the basis for the size of the .
The two shape elements that correspond to the Shape_elements that compose the Shape_elements to which the Dimensional_size_based_on_opposing_boundaries is applied shall be opposite each other.

A Directed_axis is a type of
that is an axis in which a direction is defined. A Directed_axis is defined by a base , with which the Directed_axis is congruent, and two
through which the base
passes or would pass if the Shape_elements were extended. One of the two Shape_elements is specified as the start_shape_element and the other one specified as the end_shape_element.

specifies the
through which the Directed_axis passes or would pass if the
were extended. The
specified by the end_shape_element is in the positive direction from the
specified by the start_shape_element.

specifies the
through which the Directed_axis passes or would pass if the
were extended. The
specified by the start_shape_element is in the negative direction from the
specified by the end_shape_element.

specifies the
that serves as a base axis by which the Directed_axis is defined.
The combination of axis_to_be_oriented and start_shape_element shall be unique within a population of Directed_axis.

The
shall not be populated.

The base
shall pass through or would pass through the Shape_elements specified by the start_shape_element and end_shape_element if the Shape_elements were extended.

A Datum_based_direction_element is a definition of a shape element that has the form of a half-plane and is used in conjunction with the definition of another half-plane shape element to define a . In this instance a half-plane has the form of a plane except it is bounded on one side by a straight line. The half-plane shape element that the Datum_based_direction_element defines is oriented with respect to three .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Datum_based_direction_element is dependent on the existence of one or more that specifies the Datum_based_direction_element as one of their .
specifies the of a that intersects the base and indicates the half of the base from which the half-plane shape element defined by the Datum_based_direction_element is oriented.
specifies the from which the half-plane shape element defined by the Datum_based_direction_element is oriented.
specifies the that represents the magnitude of the angle between the half-plane shape element defined by the Datum_based_direction_element and half of the specified as the base_datum_plane.

specifies the that defines the orientation of the angle between the half-plane shape element defined by the Datum_based_direction_element and half of the specified by the base_datum_plane. The angle is measured from half of the base to the defined half-plane shape element in a clockwise direction when viewed in the direction of the .

An Edge_segment_vertex is a type of . An Edge_segment_vertex supports explicit assignment of the order and connection of edge start and end points but without needing to use an explicit geometric or topological context.

An Externally_defined_dimension_representation is a type of
the interpretation of which is dependent on definitions supported externally to this part of ISO 10303.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Externally_defined_dimension_representation is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Externally_defined_dimension_representation as its . There shall be one or more
for a particular Externally_defined_dimension_representation.

ext_description.p:
specifies the
that in conjunction with the , that are specified as the definitions, represent the associated . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

example.p: The system of limits and fits specifies a way in which to represent dimensions and is defined in ISO 286.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Geometric_alignment is a type of that is a linear or planar that is established to contain two or more aligned . The from which the Geometric_alignment is established are associated with the Geometric_alignment by the that are specified as the .
In the case of a planar , at least one of the aligned shall be a linear .

A Geometric_intersection is a type of that is the common intersection of two or more . The from which the Geometric_intersection is derived are associated with the Geometric_intersection by the that are specified as the .
The from which the Geometric_intersection is derived shall intersect.

ext_description.p:
A Geometric_tolerance_qualifier is a description that qualifies one or more . A Geometric_tolerance_qualifier is either a
or a .
ext_description.note: Qualifying notes are described in 5.3 of ISO/DIS 1101.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the
to which the Geometric_tolerance_qualifier applies. There shall be one or more
for a Geometric_tolerance_qualifier.

A Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property is a type of
that specifies or partially specifies the design requirement on one or more geometric characteristics of the toleranced in which the restrictiveness of the requirement is dependent on the actual size of the produced or the actual size of the produced from which the toleranced is derived. A Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property in which the applied_material_condition_property_name is maximum_material_principle participates in specifying a requirement that is less stringent as the produced deviates from its maximum material condition towards its least material condition. In this case, the specified size of the is the base size from which it is increased by the amount the produced deviates from its maximum material condition towards its least material condition. A Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property in which the applied_material_condition_property_name is least_material_requirement participates in specifying a requirement that is less stringent as the produced deviates from its least material condition towards its maximum material condition. In this case the specified size of the is the base size from which it is increased by the amount the produced deviates from its least material condition towards its maximum material condition.

specifies the for the Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property. The applied_material_condition_property_name specifies the type of the applied material condition property, either least_material_requirement or maximum_material_principle for the Geometric_tolerance_with_applied_material_condition_property.
A Limit_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes the maximum and minimum limits of one or more .
specifies the that describes the minimum limit of the for which the Limit_dimension_representation is a representation.
specifies the that describes the maximum limit of the for which the Limit_dimension_representation is a representation.

A Linear_extension is a type of that is derived by linearly extending a that is a curve or surface. The of which the Linear_extension is an extension is associated with the Linear_extension by the that are specified as the .
The from which the Linear_extension is derived shall be a curve or surface.

A Maximum_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes the maximum limit of one or more and in which the minimum limit is not specified as it is determined by other elements of the design.

A Minimum_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes the minimum limit of one or more and in which the maximum limit is not specified as it is determined by other elements of the design.
An Opposing_boundary_set_size_characteristic is a type of that defines the distance between the two members of a . The two members may or may not be explicitly identified.
specifies the of which the distance between its two members is defined by the Opposing_boundary_set_size_characteristic.

A Parallel_shape_element_relationship is a type of
that asserts that two are parallel to each other. One
is specified as the
and the other
is specified as the
shape element.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Perpendicular_shape_element_relationship is a type of
that asserts that two
are perpendicular to each other. One
is specified as the
and the other
is specified as the
shape element.
ext_description.note:
The attribute
is declared in the
entity of which this entity is a subtype.

The attribute
shape element is declared in the
entity of which this entity is a subtype.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.

A Positional_boundary is a type of . The theoretical boundary is a boundary that cannot be intruded upon by the toleranced
if the
is an internal
(e.g., a hole) and the
is applied on a "maximum material principle" basis, or if the toleranced
is an external
(e.g., a tab) and the
is applied on a "least material requirement" basis. Additionally, the theoretical boundary is a boundary that cannot be escaped by the toleranced
if the
is an internal
and the
is applied on a "least material requirement" basis, or if the toleranced
is an external
and the
is applied on a "maximum material principle" basis. A Positional_boundary is either a
or a .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Positional_boundary as its .

The
shall not be populated.
A Positional_boundary_and_profile_boundary_member_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the from which the is offset.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_and_profile_boundary_member_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_and_profile_boundary_member_relationship as its .
specifies the from which the specified as the offset_positional_boundary is offset.
specifies the that is offset from the that is specified as the base_profile_tolerance_zone_boundary_member.
A Positional_boundary_definition is a definition that characterizes a . A Positional_boundary_definition is either a or a .
specifies the that is characterized by the Positional_boundary_definition.
A Positional_boundary_member is a type of that is a member of a . A Positional_boundary_member is defined by a in conjunction with a .
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_member is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_member as its .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_member is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_member as one of its .

A Positional_boundary_member_definition is a definition that characterizes a . Each Positional_boundary_member_definition is defined by a in conjunction with a . The shape of the is identical to that of the toleranced . However, the size of the is based on the associated , the material conditions specified by the associated , and whether the toleranced is an internal (e.g., a pair of opposing slot sides) or an external (e.g., a pair of opposing tab sides) .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_member_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_member_definition as one of its .

specifies the that defines the maximum material size and minimum material size of the toleranced . If the associated is specified on a "maximum material principle" basis, the maximum material size is used as the base size to which the specified as the tolerance_value is subtracted if the toleranced is an internal , or added if the toleranced is an external . If the associated is specified on a "least material requirement" basis, the least material size is used as the base size to which the specified as the tolerance_value is added if the toleranced is an internal , or subtracted if the toleranced is an external .
specifies the that represents the amount the size of the is reduced or enlarged from the base size that is determined by the associated and the material condition specified by the associated .
specifies the that is characterized by the Positional_boundary_member_definition.
A Positional_boundary_offset is a definition that characterizes the offset of a from a .
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Positional_boundary_offset is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Positional_boundary_offset as its .
specifies the for the Positional_boundary_offset. The associated is offset from the associated by half the distance specified by the tolerance_value.
specifies the that associates the with the from which it is offset, and which is characterized by the Positional_boundary_offset.

A Pre_defined_dimension_qualifier is a type of
the intent of which is unambiguous and is commonly used in geometric dimensioning.

specifies the , the text that provides further information about . It describes the manner in which the
that are specified as the
are qualified by the Pre_defined_dimension_qualifier. The description shall be either "average", or "free_state".
A Pre_defined_geometric_tolerance_qualifier is a type of the intent of which is unambiguous and is commonly used in geometric tolerancing.

specifies the , the text that provides further information about . It describes the manner in which the
that are specified as the
are qualified by the Pre_defined_geometric_tolerance_qualifier. The description shall be either "each_element", "each_radial_element", "free_state", "major_diameter", "minor_diameter", "not_concave", "not_convex", or "pitch_diameter".

A Profile_related_positional_boundary is a type of that is a theoretical boundary that is defined by a in conjunction with a . The defines a that is bounded by two . The Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset from one of these . The particular and the direction of offset are determined by the material conditions specified by the . If the is specified on a "maximum material principle" basis, then the from which the Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset is the one that is offset from the "away from material". Similarly, if the is specified on a "least material requirement" basis, then the from which the Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset is the one that is offset from the "towards material". The Profile_related_positional_boundary is offset from the in the same direction that the is offset from the .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Profile_related_positional_boundary is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Profile_related_positional_boundary as its .
A Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition is a type of that characterizes a . A Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition is defined by a in conjunction with a .
specifies the that characterizes the offset of the for the Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition.
specifies the that is characterized by the Profile_related_positional_boundary_definition.
A Projected_zone_and_base_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the from which the is projected.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Projected_zone_and_base_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Projected_zone_and_base_relationship as its .
specifies the that is projected from the that is specified as the base_physical_feature.
specifies the from which the that is specified as the projected_zone is projected.
The specified as the base_physical_feature shall be a feature from which it is sensible to project a .
A Projected_zone_height_characteristic is a definition that characterizes the height that a is projected from a .
specifies the that represents the height that the associated is projected relative to the associated for the Projected_zone_height_characteristic.
specifies the that associates a with the from which the is projected. The specified is characterized by the Projected_zone_height_characteristic.

A Restraint_condition is the specification of a requirement on the restraining conditions applied to a
during the verification of one or more
or . The Restraint_condition may be a . If the Restraint_condition is not a , the Restraint_condition is a requirement for all instances of and with the exception of those instances of that have a applied to them that have a description of "FREE_STATE", and those instances of that have a applied to them that have a description of "FREE_STATE".

specifies the
for the Restraint_condition. If the applied to specifies a , it is on that that the restraint requirement is applied. If a is specified as the applied_to, the Restraint_condition specifies a restraint requirement on the relationship between the and the specified by the .

specifies a role of the
for the Restraint_condition. The restraint_description should be provided.

ext_description.p:
The
shall exist and it's size shall be one.

A Runout_tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_angle is a type of that is defined by either a or a , and in which the is oriented with respect to a . The is coincident with the about which the is centred.
ext_description.note: Circular run-out tolerance in a specified direction is described in 14.13.4 of ISO 1101.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that defines the orientation of the relative to a specified for the Runout_tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_angle.
A Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the with which it is oriented.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship as its .
specifies the to which the specified is oriented by the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship.
specifies the that is oriented with respect to the specified by the Runout_tolerance_zone_orienting_relationship.
A Runout_zone_orientation is a definition that characterizes the orientation between a and a that is coincident with the about which the is centred.
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Runout_zone_orientation is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Runout_zone_orientation as its .
specifies the that represents the size of the angle between the and the .
specifies the that associates the with the with which the is oriented, and that is characterized by the Runout_zone_orientation.

ext_description.p: A Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement is a specification that indicates that a set of one or more is to be treated as a separate requirement. That is, when geometric tolerances (excluding the composite profile refinement tolerances and composite feature relating position tolerances) reference the same datum system, all the physical features to which the geometric tolerances are applied are treated as a single pattern with regard to the geometric tolerances. If this type of interrelationship is not desired, the Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement may be used to specify a set of one or more that are to be treated as a separate requirement.
ext_description.note: Separate requirements are discussed in 4.5.12 of ASME Y14.5M.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that are to be treated as a separate requirement. There shall be one or more for a Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement.

A Shape_dimension_representation is one of an , a
or a . A Shape_dimension_representation is a representation of a . The Shape_dimension_representation explicitly describes one or more
with a single value, a range of values, a combination of values, or values and references to the standard documents that define the meaning of these values.

ext_description.p: A Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement is a specification that a set of two or more is to be treated as a simultaneous requirement. That is, the shape elements to which composite profile refinement tolerances and composite feature relating position tolerances are applied are treated as separate shape elements with regard to the geometric tolerances. If this type of independence is not desired, the Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement may be used to specify a set of two or more that are to be treated as a simultaneous requirement.
ext_description.note: Simultaneous requirements are discussed in 4.5.12.1 of ASME Y14.5M.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the that are to be treated as a simultaneous requirement. There shall be two or more for a Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement.
A Singular_dimension_representation is a type of that explicitly describes one or more with a single value. A Singular_dimension_representation is one of a , a , or a .
specifies the that describes the for which the Singular_dimension_representation is a representation.

A Statistical_dimensional_tolerance is a type of that specifies design requirements that are based on sound statistics. Associated with the Statistical_dimensional_tolerance is the requirement that a specified level of process control be maintained during the manufacture of the . A Statistical_dimensional_tolerance may specify another as an alternate to the Statistical_dimensional_tolerance in the event that the specified level of process control cannot be met.
specifies the that shall be used if the specified level of process control cannot be met. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of for Statistical_dimensional_tolerance. The statistical_control_requirement should be provided.
shall exist and it's size shall be one.

A Statistical_geometric_tolerance is a type of that specifies design requirements that are based on sound statistics. Associated with the Statistical_geometric_tolerance is the requirement that a specified level of process control be maintained during the manufacture of the . A Statistical_geometric_tolerance may specify another as an alternate to the Statistical_geometric_tolerance in the event that the specified level of process control cannot be met.
specifies the that shall be used if the specified level of process control cannot be met. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of for Statistical_geometric_tolerance. The statistical_control_requirement should be provided.

ext_description.p: statistical_control_requirement shall be provided ant it's size shall be one.

A Tangent_plane is a type of
that is planar in form.

example.p: An might be applied to the Tangent_plane derived from a surface of a , as opposed to the surface itself, if variations in the form of the surface are unimportant or are sufficiently constrained by other tolerances.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.

The form of the
from which the Tangent_plane is derived shall be consistent with the form of a shape element from which a tangent plane can be derived.

A Tangent_shape_element is a type of that is either a straight line that contacts a curve at only the high points or is a plane that contacts a surface at only its high points. The from which the Tangent_shape_element is derived is associated with the Tangent_shape_element by the that is specified as the . A Tangent_shape_element may be a .
The from which the Tangent_shape_element is derived shall be a curve or surface.
A Theoretically_exact_dimension_representation is a type of that describes the theoretically exact size, form, orientation, or location of one or more .

A Tolerance_specific_restraint_condition is a type of
that is only applied to specified instances of
and .

specifies the
to which the restraint condition applies. There shall be one or more
specified as the affected_tolerances by a Tolerance_specific_restraint_condition.
A Tolerance_zone_and_viewing_plane_orienting_relationship is a relationship that associates a with the by which it is oriented.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_and_viewing_plane_orienting_relationship is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_and_viewing_plane_orienting_relationship as its .
specifies the that is oriented with respect to the specified as the orienting_viewing_plane.
specifies the by which the that is specified as the oriented_tolerance_zone is oriented.

ext_description.p: A Tolerance_zone_boundary is a type of that is a boundary of a . A Tolerance_zone_boundary is one of a , a , or a .

example.p: A pair of opposing planes may form a Tolerance_zone_boundary.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Tolerance_zone_boundary_member is a type of
that is one of the two explicitly identified members of a .

ext_description.p:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_boundary_member is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Tolerance_zone_boundary_member as one of its .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.
A Tolerance_zone_boundary_member_offset is a definition that characterizes the size and direction that a is offset from the of the toleranced .

specifies the , the label that indicates the direction that the
is offset from the . The type_of_offset shall eithe be "away_from_material" or "towards_material".
specifies the that represents distance the is offset from the .
specifies the the offset of which is characterized by the Tolerance_zone_boundary_member_offset.

A Tolerance_zone_circular_or_cylindrical_or_spherical_boundary is a type of
that is circular, cylindrical, or spherical in form. The actual form of the
is dictated by the type of tolerance and the form of the toleranced .

ext_description.p:
specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_circular_or_cylindrical_or_spherical_boundary is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Tolerance_zone_circular_or_cylindrical_or_spherical_boundary as its .

example.p:
A cylindrical
could be defined by a position tolerance applied to an axis of a cylindrical hole.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.

A Tolerance_zone_definition_with_per_unit_size_specification is a type of in which the extent of the is defined. A Tolerance_zone_definition_with_per_unit_size_specification is used to define a when the design requirements are such that abrupt variations in the toleranced must be limited. In essence, the thickness, or the diameter, of the is defined by the and the extent is defined by the . Each element of the toleranced that has the same extent as the must lie within the when the is positioned coincident with the element.
specifies the that defines the extent of the specified for the Tolerance_zone_definition_with_per_unit_size_specification.
A Tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_orientation is a type of in which the orientation of the is specified.

specifies the
for the Tolerance_zone_definition_with_specified_orientation.
A Tolerance_zone_explicit_opposing_boundary_set is a type of in which the two opposing boundary members are explicitly identified.

specifies the that comprise the Tolerance_zone_explicit_opposing_boundary_set. There shall be exactly two Tolerance_zone_boundary_members specified as boundary_members for a Tolerance_zone_explicit_opposing_boundary_set.
A Tolerance_zone_form is a definition that characterizes of the form of the .
the words by which the Tolerance_zone_form is known.
specifies the for which the Tolerance_zone_form is defined.
A Tolerance_zone_implicit_opposing_boundary_set is a type of in which the two opposing boundary members are not explicitly identified.

A Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set is a type of that consists of a set of two like boundary members that are separated by a constant distance. A Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set is either a or a .

ext_description.p: specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set as its .

example.p: Two opposing planes comprise the Tolerance_zone_opposing_boundary_set that is defined when a is applied to the top surface of a printed circuit board. The size_characteristic specifies the separation between the two opposing planes.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification is a specification of the that defines the extent of the .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification as its .

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the the extent of which is defined by the Tolerance_zone_per_unit_size_specification.
